result.execSummary:
The defendant Eronzo T Lawrence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Eronzo T Lawrence
Current: PO BOX 100313, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 02-08-2015)
Prior: 2909 N 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205
Administrative stay allowing defendant until 9/28/16 to pay fine and costs, granted.

Notice of Chapter 7 Bankruptcy Case, Meeting of Creditors, Hearing on Confirmation and Deadlines received from CMC on 6/15/15.  Bankruptcy case number 15-26556.  Bankruptcy filed 6/5/15.  All court cases include 15CF633 $443, 13TR12331 $204, 13TR12330 $166.20, 04TR1666 $167.40.

Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to the amended charge. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 2 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  This is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
-Court costs, DNA surcharge and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 2/24/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Eronzo T Lawrence in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
On motion of the State, Court amended the charge to Possession of THC, pursuant to Wis Stat 961.41(3g)(e), an unclassified misdemeanor.

Defendant Eronzo T Lawrence in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Randy Sitzberger for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

NO DRUGS!
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Eronzo T Lawrence in court with attorney Brian B. Burke.  Defendant Eronzo T Lawrence in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
